title: Innovative Leadership Development Program Based on Solobrative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic leadership theories and work experience
context.additional_context: A process where managers utilize mobile devices to simultaneously engage in self-directed learning and collaboration while solving social innovation challenges.

learning_goals: Within four weeks, learners can derive three or more core issues for solving social problems through a solo inquiry phase.
Learners can conduct at least two prototyping workshops with peer leaders during the collaborative practice phase in Week 8.
By the end of the course, learners can develop an implementation plan to apply the innovation solutions they have formed to real-world cases within their organization.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
